answers.answer: Hi,For how long have you been having the headaches?Where is the headache located?Any associated symptoms like diarrhea or constipation?Have you been having headaches previously and this has underwent some change in its character lately?Any triggers like loud noises or bright lights?If you can elaborate more on headache's character. Do keep us posted.
For about two weeks now, not really any triggers, and I don't think I've had diarreha or constipation..I had the runs, but that's it. No diarreha.

Hi,A complete consult by an internist may be able to help. Get a thorough examination of the eyes, ears, nasal passages, and sinuses.Does diabetes run in the family?Have a complete assessment so that any underlying conditions that may cause your symptoms may be determined and managed. Also, avoid any unnecessary worrying as stress and anxiety may cause somatic pain and also alter sleep patterns and appetite.Fibromyalgia is not diagnosed based on exclusion.Its diagnosis follows a specific criteria.However, other underlying conditions have to be evaluated first.
Yeah, diabetes does run in my family. Thanks for your help, I'll look into it.

question: Adolescent Sudden Chronic Headaches. They go away and comes back. How do I get rid of them??What are they caused by? Other symptoms include: Back pain, neck pain, fatigue, lack of sleep, sometimes I have excessive thirst, eye pain, bad eyesight, see diffrent colors sometimes, and I'm hungry a lot.My step dad had Acoustic Nuermoa, and that happens to like 1 in 100,000 people or something like that, so I'm positive I don't have it. There is no way my family is that unlucky. I doubt I have any brain tumors, as a matter of fact. Fibromyalgia runs in my family, but I do not think head aches and eye problems are a symptom of this. Please help!
title: Chronic Headaches. How do I get rid of them?
